p: The most populated regions of the Asian continent are characterized by a distinct monsoonal climate, spanning from the Indian subcontinent to the extratropics of eastern Asia. The summer monsoon brings over 80% of the annual rainfall in these regions, essential for local economy, agriculture, ecosystems, and human health (Hong & Kim, 2011; Piao et al., 2010). In addition, as a major part of the summertime overturning circulation in the Northern Hemisphere tropics, the Asian monsoon has profound remote influences on the global‚Äêscale climate (Lin & Wu, 2012; Rodwell & Hoskins, 1996). Previous studies have shown that the Asian summer monsoon has weakened during the twentieth century, with anthropogenic aerosols being a likely cause (Bollasina et al., 2011; Ganguly et al., 2012a; Li et al., 2015; Ramanathan et al., 2005). However, the exact trends and reasons remain unclear with large uncertainties in climate model simulations (Turner & Annamalai, 2012).
